field.name: MLOps
field.description: Machine learning operations, model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.

problems.title: The Production Gap: 87% of Machine Learning Models Never Reach Deployment
problems.description: Despite significant investments in machine learning development, Gartner and other industry analysts report that approximately 85-87% of ML models never make it to production. This 'production gap' represents a massive waste of resources and unrealized business value. The challenges span technical issues (infrastructure complexity, API design, latency requirements), organizational barriers (siloed teams, lack of MLOps maturity), and operational hurdles (monitoring, scaling, integration with existing systems). Unlike traditional software, ML systems require continuous monitoring, retraining, and validation against evolving data patterns. Models that perform well in development environments often fail catastrophically when deployed at scale due to differences in data distribution, infrastructure constraints, and real-world edge cases.
problems.summary: 87% of ML models never reach production due to deployment complexity, organizational silos, and the fundamental challenges of operationalizing machine learning systems at scale.

barriers: Organizational silos between data science and engineering
Skills gap in production ML engineering

neglectedness.fundingLevel: High - MLOps market projected at $4B by 2025

rootCauses.description: Organizational silos between data scientists and engineering/operations teams
Lack of standardized MLOps practices and tooling
Gap between development environment and production infrastructure
Insufficient focus on production requirements during model development

consequences.description: Massive waste of ML investment - models developed but never deployed
Lost competitive advantage from AI capabilities
Data science team frustration and talent attrition

existingSolutions.description: Optimized inference servers for production ML deployment

solutionGaps.description: One-click deployment from notebook to production

solutionGaps.opportunity: Industry standards and certifications for MLOps

sources.title: Production ML: 6 Key Challenges & Insights
sources.relevantExcerpt: Models often break when they are deployed in the real world, failing to adapt to changes in environment dynamics or data.

sources.title: Top MLOps Challenges for Startups & Enterprises in 2025
sources.relevantExcerpt: 87% of machine learning models never make it to production, often due to poorly designed pipelines.

sources.title: MLOps best practices, challenges and maturity models
sources.relevantExcerpt: Organizations face three main challenges: lack of standardized practices, difficulties in maintaining model consistency and scalability, and ambiguities in assessing MLOps maturity.

problems.title: Model Drift and Performance Degradation in Production ML Systems
problems.description: Machine learning models naturally degrade over time as the real-world data they encounter deviates from training data. This 'drift' manifests in multiple forms: data drift (changes in input feature distributions), concept drift (changes in the relationship between features and targets), and upstream drift (changes in data pipelines). Shopify documented significant performance degradation in their recommendation models during the 2020 holiday season due to changing consumer behavior. Without continuous monitoring and retraining, models produce increasingly unreliable predictions, leading to suboptimal business decisions. The challenge is compounded by delayed ground truth (e.g., loan default outcomes take years to materialize) and the difficulty of distinguishing meaningful drift from noise.
problems.summary: ML models degrade over time as real-world data diverges from training data, requiring continuous monitoring and retraining that many organizations lack the infrastructure to perform.

barriers: Complexity of distinguishing meaningful drift from noise

rootCauses.description: Real-world data distributions are non-stationary and constantly evolving
Models are trained on historical snapshots that become outdated
Lack of monitoring infrastructure in many ML deployments
Ground truth labels often unavailable or significantly delayed

consequences.description: Gradual degradation of prediction accuracy over time
Business decisions based on increasingly unreliable predictions
Sudden model failures when drift accumulates past critical thresholds
Scrambled responses when drift is finally detected, disrupting operations

existingSolutions.name: ML Monitoring Platforms (Evidently AI, Arize)
existingSolutions.description: Tools for detecting data drift, model performance degradation, and anomalies

existingSolutions.name: Statistical Drift Detection (KS Test, PSI)
existingSolutions.description: Statistical methods for comparing training and production data distributions

existingSolutions.name: Continuous Training Pipelines
existingSolutions.description: Automated retraining systems triggered by performance degradation or schedule

solutionGaps.description: Proactive drift prediction before performance degrades
solutionGaps.opportunity: Predictive drift detection using leading indicators

solutionGaps.description: Drift detection without ground truth labels
Automated root cause analysis for detected drift

stakeholders.description: ML engineers responsible for production model performance
Business teams relying on model predictions

sources.title: What is data drift in ML, and how to detect and handle it
sources.relevantExcerpt: Drift describes how the performance of a machine learning model in production slowly gets worse over time.

sources.title: Model Drift in Machine Learning
sources.relevantExcerpt: Inaccurate or outdated models due to drift can lead to suboptimal decision-making and pose potential business risk.

sources.title: How to Detect Model Drift in MLOps Monitoring
sources.relevantExcerpt: Shopify documented how their product recommendation models experienced significant performance degradation during the 2020 holiday season.
